oai_dc:dc.dc:title: ANALYTICAL SOLUTION FOR THE WAVE-INDUCED EXCESS PORE-PRESSURE IN A FINITE-THICKNESS SEABED LAYER
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Magda, Waldemar
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: analytical solution
pore pressure
finite thickness layer
bed layer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper presents the analytical solution to the wave-induced excess porepressure oscillations in permeable seabed sediments, derived for the case of limited thickness of the seabed layer. In order to show the utility of the analytical solution, a wide parameter study has been performed with a special emphasis to the relative compressibility of the two-phase (soil skeleton - porefluid) medium. The results of example computations are discussed with respect to the accuracy of the 'finite-thickness' analytical solution for the pore-pressure.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 24 (1994): Proceedings of 24th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Kobe, Japan, 1994.
